newsitem.title: UK: OPTIONS -Straddle sold in Rolls Royce.
newsitem.headline: OPTIONS -Straddle sold in Rolls Royce.

text.p: Trading in UK stock options effectively ground to a halt by early afternoon on Friday as the market awaited payroll statistics from the U.S., dealers said.
But two of the larger deals concerned reflected differing views on volatility of the underlying shares.

In aero-engine manufacturer Rolls Royce the main trade was from a seller of 500 November 240 puts and calls at 8-1/2p and 11p each which will make 19-1/2p maximum profit at expiry if the underlying shares finish at 240p.
By 1210 GMT, the shares were unchanged at 235p.

Over in cellular phone company Vodafone the chief deal was a long strangle established by buying 250 November 220 puts at 6-1/2p as well as 250 November 260 calls at 2p anticipating greater stock price volatility.
In order to make money at expiry, Vodafone shares need to either go below 211-1/2p or go above 268-1/2p.
Elsewhere, in industrial holdings company Williams Holdings a bearish deal was struck by one trader buying 500 November 360 puts at 8-1/2p.
The company will announce its half-year results on September 10, and its shares added 1-1/2p to 365p.
Also reflecting a bearish tendency was the deal in insurer Prudential Corporation where there was a seller of 200 November 390 calls at 43p.
